snippet: The police say that a special-education teacher, a screwdriver his tool of choice, stole a poster mounted in a subway car on Tuesday.
abstract: Michael Wilson Crime Scene column on theft by special-education teacher James Taveras of an art poster from a New York City subway car; Taveras told arresting officers that that he wanted the poster, which he could have purchased in the Metropolitan Transportation Authority store, for his classroom at the Urban Science Academy in the Bronx.
lead_paragraph: The police say that a special-education teacher, a screwdriver his tool of choice, stole a poster mounted in a subway car on Tuesday.

headline.seo: An Art Heist Aboard the No. 6 Train
headline.main: Two Screws Were No Match for a Brazen Subway Art Thief
headline.print_headline: Two Screws Were No Match For a Brazen Subway Art Thief
